source.prefix: The owl of Minerva spreads its wings only with the falling of the dusk.
The life of man [is] solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
We live in the best of all possible worlds.
Entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily.
To be is to be perceived (Esse est percipi).
The unexamined life is not worth living.
Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
One cannot step twice in the same river.
Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your hearts desire; the other is to get it.
